tip: When flying, consider purchasing a carbon offset
body: Buying offsets helps individuals take into account the environmental costs of air travel. Usually by paying for the increase in carbon sinks like planting seaweed or a tree.
By having more people per flight, you're able to spread the emissions over more ppl increasing efficiency.
Landing and takeoff are emission heavy procedures. By taking direct flights you reduce the amount of times it occurs.
By take daytime flights as contrails and cirrus clouds create heat-trapping effects at night but reflect sunlight during the day.
Some airlines are more well equipped at ensuring planes are at full load and fly more efficient planes.
Walk, take public transportation, carpool, rideshare or bike to your destination. This not only reduces CO2 emissions, it also lessens traffic congestion and the idling associated with it.
Studies have shown aggressive driving can result in more fuel consumption than consistent, calm driving.
Properly inflated tires can increase your fuel efficiency
By combining errands, you reduce the amount of time spent driving

tip: Consider purchasing a hybrid of electric vehicle
body: If you're shopping for a new car, consider purchasing a hybrid or electric vehicle. Your government may offer credits to reduce the total cost.
